Posts.Content: Mar 16, 2011 06:38AM gjaillier wrote: I know this is an older thread, but I hope someone can give me some additional info.  I had six rounds of TAC (finished in April 2010) and had very aggressive radiation because I had 2 local cancer recurrences just after starting radiation.  I had a muga scan before beginning chemo, and no problems were indicated with my heart at that time.   A month or so ago, I was experiencing shortness of breath, etc. and went for an echocardiogram.  My ejection fraction is 35%.  Mind you, I am very overweight, which doesn't help heart matters at all.  I recently started an exercise program at the local YMCA.  I am doing cardio and some strength training.  My question is, can you increase your ejection fraction/reverse CHF at all through exercise? I haven't been to a cardiologist yet, but I'm sure I will within the next month.
Posts.Title: Side Effect:Congestive Heart Failure pixma lago
